website_summaries.verdict: Those needing a reliable set of Cobra pliers will find their match in this versatile pack.
pros: Set comes with 7-, 10-, and 12-inch Cobra pliers to handle almost any project
Provide more gripping capacity than previous models
cons: More expensive than purchasing a single set of pliers

website_summaries.verdict: Excellent quality in pliers. Includes three sizes of tools that will help you finish most jobs around the home.
pros: Safe set of pliers that contains a guard to prevent pinched fingers
Non-slip plastic coating on the handles
Jaw of the pliers can be adjusted to work on different shapes of pipes and nuts
One of the most popular brand names in high-end tools
Three sizes of cobra pliers included
cons: Cost of the set runs higher than most pliers sets
Doesn't offer different types of pliers

customer_reviews.title: The 3 Pliers to Rule Them All - More precious in my tool bag than the Ring of Power!
customer_reviews.text: These were forged in the fires of Mt. Doom and cannot be unmade except in the fires of Germany where they were made! If any adjustable pliers were more powerful than Knipex - the histories do not tell us. I've got 'em all - irwin, craftsmen, klien, channel lock (which are very very big and strong) but these are the best. The teeth are made of mithril and have a +3 grip vs. iron. Thru some form of elvish magic they seem 1/3 lighter than channel lock yet grip as tho the fate of middle earth depended on them. Buy them now!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: WALTER S JANN

customer_reviews.title: which are fantastic, but often times I need the wider range ...
customer_reviews.text: You can't go wrong with Knipex if your budget allows for them. I already had the parallel version, which are fantastic, but often times I need the wider range of opening that these offer. At the tip is a beefy parallel, grooved section that's great for grabbing and leveraging things, as well as holding a nut for quick assembly. Farther back is the business end that excels in holding a larger nut. The spring button is easy to use and extremely helpful. Rubber hasn't budged on any of the handles yet. I literally tossed all my cheaper pliers, replacing them with Knipex a little at a time to easy the $ting.
customer_reviews.author: T. Beaulieu

customer_reviews.title: old school
customer_reviews.text: These things work as the "wrong tool for the job" like how I used to do as a kid. I mean this in a good way. Like gripping onto a stripped out screw. The kinda job I had given up on pliers for. The jaws also open wayyy up. Allowing me to use the smallest pair for bicycle head stocks. A size that would usually require a medium set of channel locks. All in all, I love these. The little ones I use most cause they just so dang good.
customer_reviews.author: scott m.

customer_reviews.title: Must have in every tool bag
customer_reviews.text: I needed a pair of channellocks one day and reached in my buddies bag and pulled out his knipex cobras. I’ve heard of knipex, but had not seen the “channellocks” made by knipex. These totally changed my world. Gripping strength, locking in place feature, and comfort would be the top qualities. The video of the guy standing on these is legit, and not quite so dramatic of an effect but you will absolutely notice your grip loosen while torquing down on these. I’ll never own or recommend another brand. These are must have, worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Buy once, cry once.
customer_reviews.text: If you want quality, you go with Knipex. These may be a little pricey, but you can't beat the quality of these. These will grip on to anything you need. The quick adjustment works like a charm and feels solidly built.
customer_reviews.author: Mitch Martin

customer_reviews.title: Nuts dont stand a chance
customer_reviews.text: You can never have too many pairs of pliers so why not own the best? These arent regular channel locks and I was skeptical until I tried them. You dont have to squeeze down as tight as humanly possible when breaking things loose like traditional channel locks. These jaws dont slip on anything either.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmer

customer_reviews.title: Very good, but overpriced.  Think carefully about how much you really need them.
customer_reviews.text: These are the best channel-locking type pliers I’ve ever owned. They’re also overpriced and overkill unless you’re in the trades and using them every day. A typical DIYer will be perfectly happy with a good set of “blue handle” Channel Locks or even similar Irwin pliers for 1/3rd the cost. And you’ll be a lot less upset when those less pricey pliers magically disappear from your work bench or wind up forgotten in your yard for a few weeks. True, you can brag to the neighbor about these fine Knipex beauties, but they really aren’t that much more effective than more mundane brands for most jobs.
customer_reviews.author: B. Walker

customer_reviews.title: Throw out those rusty old cheap-ass channel lock pliers and get with a serious tool
customer_reviews.text: High quality tools with amazing clamping power. The small one is perfect for your pocket, the medium for the go-to and the large for when you really need to reef on something. Throw out those rusty old cheap-ass channel lock pliers and get with a serious tool.
customer_reviews.author: K. James

customer_reviews.title: Best channel locks I have used to date
customer_reviews.text: Amazing pliers. They work great and have nice thin jaws that will fit it tight spots. Only issue I had with these was that the jaws didnt line up perfectly all of the time. I ended up returning them because I thought I just got a bad set but I replaced them with a comfort grip set and this is an issue with all of them. I guess it's not a big issue but I expected perfection from what I heard about these
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Quality set of slipjoint pliers!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great , high quality set of slipjoint pliers with all the right sizes in on package. The push button slide makes these pliers a sinch to use. The special shape of the jaws make an easy way to get a good hold on materials and makes it easier to get ahold of rounded off nuts and bolts. You really get a good grip and a great amount of pressure. The tools are solidly made and the handles feel just right. The locking mechanism works rather well and they make a great addition to anyone's tool collection.
customer_reviews.author: Rich W

customer_reviews.title: The love child of channel-lock pliers and pipe-wrenches.
customer_reviews.text: I use these when working with gas pipe, demo-pipe, rando-twirly bits, and irritating thingeys that need to be grabbed. In a pinch they work great as a pipe wrench in spaces that I can't get my smallest 12" Rigid. For service calls, pared with the smooth jawed variety, and a 6-1 screwdriver I can trouble shoot 90% of the small tasks I encounter. I 100% recommend these for professionals or people who love high-quality tools.
customer_reviews.author: Rocky Mountain Tradesman

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I’m an electrician and I use these daily tightening various types of connectors and other hardware and for many things in between. I love the grip on these pliers, very sturdy and aggressive. I rarely get slipping. I like the push button adjustment, although it basically requires two hands to adjust. I like that with the push button adjustment the pliers remains locked into place until you move it, unlike other types of channel lock pliers.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Best adjustable pliers you can buy.
customer_reviews.text: I love knipex. These are undoubtedly my favorite adjustable pliers of all time. I'm always losing these at work and that's the reason why I have to by new ones! Other coworkers also like them so much they try and snatch them. However, I have yet to break these in the 15 years I been using these. I have seen one pair break. But my coworker was beating them with a hammer.
customer_reviews.author: Z Knisley

customer_reviews.title: Best pliers on the market
customer_reviews.text: These are great pliers. However I did just break one. I am a plumber and I have broken channel lock brand milwaulkee brand and Irwin brand pliers rather easily. Even though I just broke one of these it did take a lot to actually break. Would still recommend these. They bite really well almost never slip. Hopefully it's easy to replace the broken one
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: Quality Quality Quality!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love these pliers I read many comments on how people said they would throw away their typical blue handled pliers and it's true I work as a facility maintenance mechanic in a manufacturing plant and anything I buy for tools goes through the real test and these things are great I have nothing bad to say about them
customer_reviews.author: Michael Borges

customer_reviews.title: Best pliers on the planet.
customer_reviews.text: Best pliers on the planet. Anyone that has ever used these will say the same. The way they are designed makes them work a lot like a pipoe wrench, when you are tightening or loosening. THEY GRIP WHATEVER YOU ARE GRABBING! With very little need to squeeze the handles hard to prevent slipping. HIGHLY RECOMMEND
customer_reviews.author: I want it

customer_reviews.title: Worth it.
customer_reviews.text: Love this product. Use the 10 and 12 inch pliers daily as a union electrician working industrial job sites. The 7s come in handy less frequently but are a life saver when needed. These pliers allow me to grip materials with far more confidence then common tongue and groove pliers. I can stand on the 12s. Just about anyone whose tried them has made the switch from, cheap channel locks that wear quickly and don't hold nearly as tight.
customer_reviews.author: Owen Wall

customer_reviews.title: Great pliers for gripping
customer_reviews.text: I use these while working as an A&P mechanic for a regional airlines. They are very adjustable to get the right grip on the piece you want to hold without the handles being to long or to far apart to grip. These work great for working in tight areas. The jaws are awesome and you achieve a good grip with less chance of slipping and marring the surface of the component you are working on.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan C Reed

customer_reviews.title: best pliers on the market
customer_reviews.text: I own this set plus multiple other sizes, and these are the best adjustable pliers you can buy. they bite hard and lock on to anything. My vice grips are now in the bottom of my tool box, because these do the job just as well.
customer_reviews.author: adam

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price
customer_reviews.text: These are worth the price, strong, durable, precise. Comfy grip. That button lock is finer than your standard channel locks - I should have picked something like this up long ago.
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: these are awsome
customer_reviews.text: these work great. I am an oil field mechanic and know how to be abusive to a tool. theses take and surpass it. they grip good and are comfortable to use. Would defiantly buy again, and defiantly worth the money. These are a tool that are built for a life time.
customer_reviews.author: Tisha

customer_reviews.title: Very good product
customer_reviews.text: I don't usually leave a review on products i buy here because I don't like to waste my time but this are worth it. They are the best pairs of pliers i have ever bought. They are cheaper on amazon than buying them in town. I usually work with steel pipe and fittings but recently i had to work with stainless steel pipe and fittings, I was afraid to ruined them the first day i got them but they are holding strong and have not disappointed me nor have they gotten dulled.
customer_reviews.author: Orange

customer_reviews.title: Must have!
customer_reviews.text: Like any mechanic will admit these work great as a hammer in a pinch. I have had these for a short time an they can definitely withstand the beating I throw at them! As well they work great for the intended use as well!
customer_reviews.author: Thomas James Myers

customer_reviews.title: Great fit
customer_reviews.text: I went through (2) two name brand water pump pliers (channel locks), Klein's Journeyman Line and Milwaukee's with the V-jaws, before final finding the perfect ones for me. I highly recommend these for anyone using water pump pliers (channel locks) daily.
customer_reviews.author: Cornelius A. Martin

customer_reviews.title: Great pliers , the lock feature is nice
customer_reviews.text: These are very good pliers , the lock feature is nice for repetitive work no need to keep adjusting. The jaw teeth are sharp and don’t slip . They won’t pinch your hand .
customer_reviews.author: JRod

customer_reviews.title: best ever
customer_reviews.text: Use these dogs for a few days and you'll throw your Channelocks in the recycling bin. Best I've ever seen. Best part is how thin they are without sacrificing strength. They ARE worth the extra money. If you're in the trades do yourself a huge favor and pick up a set Update: A few months of daily beatings and abuse, still like new!
customer_reviews.author: Kurt

customer_reviews.title: These things will save the day .
customer_reviews.text: You’ll wonder how you ever got anything done without these . They grip like nothing else and will get the job done when you’d otherwise be struggling . Worth every penny . The grips are a little bit more delicate than you might expect but still hold up pretty good .
customer_reviews.author: Colby

customer_reviews.title: These grip even tighter than vise grips!
customer_reviews.text: Had a allen screw which couldn't be preyed loose with the Allen wrenches, tried several kinds of plyers, but none could grip tight enough. The knipx didn't let me down!
customer_reviews.author: J-P

customer_reviews.title: They are terrific pliers as you would expect for the price
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Alligator pliers last year but really wanted the Cobra pliers. luckily they were on sale, so I had to buy them. They are terrific pliers as you would expect for the price. The angle in the jaws allows you to grab onto bolts with ease. These are the pliers you buy once and never have to replace.
customer_reviews.author: Jlwaters11

customer_reviews.title: Best channel lock style pliers that I have ever used
customer_reviews.text: Best channel lock style pliers that I have ever used. The narrow head helps reach in tighter places and there is no sacrifice in grip strength or applicable torque. Prefer these over the higher end blue channellocks pliers, craftsmans, and snap ons. Have the alligator knipex pliers as well but these get more use due to the handiness of the adjustable system and the way it holds it in place.
customer_reviews.author: WuTangBangah

customer_reviews.title: High quality German made!
customer_reviews.text: German made high quality product. I like the idea that they are narrower than regular Channel-Lock pliers. The locking system is faster to use than the "hope you guessed it right" approach from the Channel-Lock system. Jaws grab and hold as advertised. Quality shows.
customer_reviews.author: ahiker4u

customer_reviews.title: Excellent set of locking pliers
customer_reviews.text: Use these frequently in my job as a field service engineer. Tough, durable, don't rust. Count on these for a huge variety of jobs involving hydraulic, water, pneumatic and general mechanical, Because of their quality they sometimes grow legs of their own and walk away from from a jobsite. Knipex is a name you can count on, I use many other of their tools for their quality and durability.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Haymans

customer_reviews.title: Thin, light and durable.
customer_reviews.text: I'm an electrician and 1st I bought myself a set and a year later I bought my son, who is also an electrician, a set. I now buy almost every apprentice I have a set because they need the best tools. I have a set in my garage tool chest and another in my wife's tool bag in the house. I am very impressed with them. They are well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: ted reynolds

customer_reviews.title: Best Pliers Ever!  Worth Every Penny!
customer_reviews.text: These are the best adjustable pliers, no question! I really like the adjustment mechanism on these, much easier to use than the traditional channel-lock design. If you are serious about your tools, these will not let you down. You get what you pay for, and these are worth the extra cash.
customer_reviews.author: Stevie

customer_reviews.title: Best pliers I've owned
customer_reviews.text: These are seriously the best pliers I've owned. Grip like you wouldn't believe. Also, there is a spot for crimping wire connectors that works better than any of the multiple crimpers I own. Works very well crimping heat shrink connectors without damaging the heat shrink.
customer_reviews.author: JW

customer_reviews.title: Great Knipex Tool Assortment
customer_reviews.text: Gotta love the ease of operation provided by Knipex tools. This set has the right sized tool for all your needs. Pliers are highly adjustable for the right size needed.
customer_reviews.author: Eddie Howard

customer_reviews.title: Another great product from Knipex
customer_reviews.text: They are knipex and work amazing. I have used some cheaper pliers but grip on these are just amazing. Little pricy but worth it if your going to be using it pretty often.
customer_reviews.author: A-Gre3wal

customer_reviews.title: Best quality and life span you'll ever have
customer_reviews.text: Probably the best tool I've ever bought they lock onto whatever your using them on the teeth dig right in. Co worker has the same ones he's been using them for over 10 years same set
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Rochat

customer_reviews.title: They live up to the hype!
customer_reviews.text: These pliers absolutely live up to their reputation. It makes all of my other pliers obsolete. Extremely tough teeth and high quality will impress you with each use.
customer_reviews.author: mdhultst

customer_reviews.title: money well spent
customer_reviews.text: its a Snap-on of Europe made in Germany.... o wait... it is Snap-on now - they bought them. If You buy Knipex in the states - snapon dealer will warrantee it for ya and replace it if necessary , for life! get get any better then that.
customer_reviews.author: RimRules

customer_reviews.title: Amazing grip.
customer_reviews.text: I dislike the price and that is about the only bad thing I can think of. These are strong and grip extremely well. Assembly and disassembly of piping and fittings are a breeze with this tool.
customer_reviews.author: B1

customer_reviews.title: Big shout-out to KNIPEX
customer_reviews.text: Knipex is a respected brand of quality tools you can't go wrong with knipex. After buying my first pliers with them I knew, I had found something worthy.
customer_reviews.author: Therrera

customer_reviews.title: Great set of pliers
customer_reviews.text: These are definitely high quality tools. I had the five inch Cobra pliers already, and liked them so well that I ordered this set. I gave my Craftsman arc-joint pliers to one of my sons. I haven't used the Knipex a lot and am still getting used to adjusting them, but find that they do the job I ask of them. I'm sure I'll have these a long time, IF they don't "grow legs" and walk off.
customer_reviews.author: Rick in Columbia, SC

customer_reviews.title: ) Excellent, high quality 2
customer_reviews.text: Things to know about Knipex tools. 1.) Excellent, high quality 2.) They are not cheap
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Scott

customer_reviews.title: Electrician: amazing channel locks
customer_reviews.text: I love these channel locks! Probably some of the highest quality tools I have. I’m very glad I forked over the cash for them. I am an electrician and I use them on compression couplings. They work like a dream
customer_reviews.author: Steven Thomson

customer_reviews.title: These Kick A@@
customer_reviews.text: I never thought I would buy such an expensive set of pliers but I did and they are great! What makes these stand out above all others is the tremendous grip. I have been able to pull nails when the heads broke off and left a small stub, unscrew screws when they are stripped. I have had them for a couple years now, I always put one of these in my tool bag for road trips because they are so reliable and can be used in place of standard wrenches in a pinch.
customer_reviews.author: BDW

customer_reviews.title: Absoutely the best, hands down.
customer_reviews.text: These are the industry standard for pliers, hands down. They micro adjust which makes them even better. Expensive, yep. You will give away your other pliers or let the guys borrow them, but not these.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew K. Barkley

customer_reviews.title: Great pliers
customer_reviews.text: These things don't let go. Haven't had cobra pliers before, so can't compare them to other brands, but these took the place of my channelocks real quick.
customer_reviews.author: ChodieGrundleson

customer_reviews.title: I don't know if I'd buy them again
customer_reviews.text: Nice set of over priced pliers they do crip nicely if they can grab a hold but for the money I don't know if I buy them again
customer_reviews.author: terry

customer_reviews.title: Buy ‘em!
customer_reviews.text: Freaking great channel locks. Best I have ever owned. Knipex rules. Worth the extra bucks to get excellent quality for this type tool. When the Knipex Cobras grab on to something they really bite into it.
customer_reviews.author: Lanthanon

customer_reviews.title: Great wrenches - best price around.
customer_reviews.text: These were ordered for my husband to use at work and home. Excellent quality and great price. We’ve seen this three pack elsewhere for alot more.
customer_reviews.author: Mya

customer_reviews.title: A good set of pliers for plumbers
customer_reviews.text: Pliers take some time to get used to. Otherwise the locking feature and teeth grip on to what is needed.
customer_reviews.author: Keith B.

customer_reviews.title: Best pliers that I own
customer_reviews.text: Extremely adjustable. They lock in place once you adjust them and they dont move around on you. The teeth on the pliers are also super aggresive which i really like. Superb quality overall.
customer_reviews.author: Tweakes182

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: Great set of tools and cheaper than you’ll find in most stores. I use this set all the time and have had mine over a year and have had zero issues. These grab and hold!
customer_reviews.author: Russell / EOT Crane Technician

customer_reviews.title: Simply the best on the market.
customer_reviews.text: I’m an auto mechanic. After constantly borrowing these from my coworker i finally needed to buy my own. These are better than snap-on or Irwin or channellock. They will hold onto anything. You will break your car or yourself before these break loose.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great pliers
customer_reviews.text: Worth the money, these pliers don't slip like normal slip joint pliers.
customer_reviews.author: Barry C. Morris

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: No more pinched fingers don't slip off like other pliers expensive but get what you pay for its a tool that will last wished i bought them a long time ago
customer_reviews.author: J. w

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Awesome ! Love that they lock! Well worth the money. Very durable.
customer_reviews.author: Sunny

customer_reviews.title: Best Adjustable Pliers Made
customer_reviews.text: These adjustable pliers are awesome !!! Easily adjustable and grip like no other. No other adjustable plier compares.
customer_reviews.author: coolreed

customer_reviews.title: Can’t beat the number of uses you can perform with these!
customer_reviews.text: The best pliers for your money! Absolutely the best anywhere or by any maker! German engineering and steel, doesn’t wear out easily!
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Siler

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect.
customer_reviews.text: My only gripe with these is that the jaws don’t open particularly wide for the size of these tools. If I could do it again I would just buy the 250mm and the 400mm. That said, they grip extremely well and are very lightweight.
customer_reviews.author: jmohr

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: Very expensive but still the best pair of this type of pliers I have every own. Makes other brands seem like junk. If you are looking for quality tools then this is the brand to buy
customer_reviews.author: Gary Greene

customer_reviews.title: Great buy and the price is right
customer_reviews.text: Use them every day in only missing one in the whole set and it's the larger one
customer_reviews.author: Matthew w.

customer_reviews.title: Much better then normal channel locks
customer_reviews.text: Great pliers. I use these every day for commercial electrical work. My one complaint is the handle on my small pliers was skinned by scraping against a metal stud, which is slightly annoying but not a huge deal. Sometimes the pushbutton doesn't want to engage properly. Just gotta wiggle the handle until it pops
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Why did I wait so long. Can't say enough about Knipex Pliers. Easier to lock into position than standard channel lock pliers. Last forever.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Shipley

customer_reviews.title: Quality tools
customer_reviews.text: These pliers grip as good as a pipe wrench. I use them to tight 1 inch pipe with no problem. I would buy these again in a heartbeat. Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: David Goralski

customer_reviews.title: German Precision.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent Pliers. German precision built with German steel, it's what you would expect and not anything like these Chinese made competitors. They are worth the money. They grip and hold things very well.
customer_reviews.author: Jason White

customer_reviews.title: Light comfortable good quality great sharp teeth!!
customer_reviews.text: Wow these guys impress the heck out of me! I thought man from the reviews these things must really work well! I finally got to put them to good use at work and WOW they work Great! Light little channel lock and adjustable jars with a easy push button that locks it firmly back into place. Overall they where a little spendy but in the end it was worth it! My cowoker liked them so much he bought his own set of them!
customer_reviews.author: john

customer_reviews.title: If your looking here.... Just buy them
customer_reviews.text: I saw these on the Macto truck... Price was $198 (not matco brand.. Knipex band.. Same set) Definitely worth this price
customer_reviews.author: Mark robinson

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: I use this at work everyday. I had a torch on it. Water ,dirt. Still works great.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: These pliers are great. If you put together any rigid conduit these ...
customer_reviews.text: These pliers are great. If you put together any rigid conduit these are the best. But I also use them to hold stuff for drilling, etc. You won't be disappointed with any knipex tools
customer_reviews.author: William K.

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: As a professional plumber, the holding power is by far the best I've used. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Grips very well
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy pliers with a good grip. I hope they're worth the extra money in the long run.
customer_reviews.author: Charles S.

customer_reviews.title: they will grab about every thing
customer_reviews.text: like that they will turn things that are round and stripped
customer_reviews.author: Tom R.

customer_reviews.title: Great Deal Good Tool Good Grip
customer_reviews.text: I should have these set before instead of trying other named brands.
customer_reviews.author: Monching

customer_reviews.title: carefull. they’ll get stolen or lost before you where them out
customer_reviews.text: love these best pair of channel locks you’ll ever own. and this is my second set
customer_reviews.author: Chris Merrow

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality
customer_reviews.text: Delivered on time. Very high quality tools. My boyfriend a contractor loved them.
customer_reviews.author: Bani Lariche

customer_reviews.title: These are the best gripping pliers on the market by far
customer_reviews.text: These are the best gripping pliers on the market by far. Grade A, top of the line. There is no other plier that will even come close to griping the way these pliers grip. They will not let loose! I highly recommend. Quality is superb!!
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: High quality
customer_reviews.text: I am an electrician and work with conduit frequently. These pliers work very well, appear a bit pricey but once you use them you will see why; very well made and designed. The biggest issue will be ensuring these tools do not grow legs and leave my tool box!
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: 7 Stars is the correct Rating! These are outstanding
customer_reviews.text: Knipex cobra pliers are to die for - the best pliers I have ever had - these three are additions to the other two I bought a year or so ago. Craftsmen water pump pliers are a joke compared to these. Was hesitating at first due to the price but are receiving them and using them I total forgot the cost - they are more than worth it. Love em!
customer_reviews.author: Sloane Schrodinger

customer_reviews.title: Grips better too!
customer_reviews.text: Best bang for your buck, even better than the ole gal behind the theater!
customer_reviews.author: Devin Dillon

customer_reviews.title: High quality good price
customer_reviews.text: Professional tools.It values more.With these pliers u will have acces and grip wherever it needs.Ergonomic handles wont push your palms too much so u will have more strenght of grip.Simply amazing possibilities.No#1 plumbing pliers.Set replaces alot of tools
customer_reviews.author: Aleksandar131

customer_reviews.title: best I have used
customer_reviews.text: typically I hAVE used channel lock pliers. these surpass that performance in almost all ways
customer_reviews.author: Brian Cox

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Love them, use at least one of the pliers daily
customer_reviews.author: Nathanael D King

customer_reviews.title: Best pliers.
customer_reviews.text: Love these pliers blow channel locks away with ease use them daily at work on at equipment.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Bils

customer_reviews.title: Requires half the force of normal channel locks

customer_reviews.title: Great Made German Tools!
customer_reviews.text: Well made German tools! A little expensive but, worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Great pliers, worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: As others have stated, don't let the price on the Cobra pliers keep you from owning a set. These are remarkably versatile and incredibly well made. I have no doubt they'll last a lifetime (at least) and that I won't end up breaking these like some cheap knock offs or import pliers. Save yourself some money and buy the set, rather than the individual pliers. It's good to have them in a couple sizes and this set should have most people covered for the most part. Knipex is a quality, German made brand and these are some of their best pliers. Don't pass 'em up!

product_meta.title: KNIPEX Tools - 3 Piece Cobra Pliers Set (7, 10, & 12) (002006US1)
product_meta.description:
Style:Pliers SetThis popular pliers set is a great starter set for all of your push-button cobra water pump pliers. The set includes all the most popular size pliers including a 7-inch, 10-inch and 12-inch.Equipped with an anti-pinching guard to prevent finger crushing.

AMAZON.COM


Self locking on pipes and nuts (view larger).No more time-consuming test-adjusting to achieve the correct size. With the Knipex Cobra water pump pliers, you can simply position the upper jaw to the workpiece, push the button, and close the lower jaw. And you'll also be able to say goodbye to blood blisters you get with other gripping pliers. With safety its first priority, Knipex has designed a built-in pinch guard that prevents blood blisters on your hand.

The unique self-locking adjustment and induction hardened gripping teeth means that once it's set, it stays. There's no slipping and no need to waste strength squeezing the pliers — ensuring operator safety and more efficient work. Cobra's unique jaw configuration can grip any shape object — flat, round, hex, or square. It also eliminates nut burring to avoid stripping pipes, nuts, or bolts. Additionally, the Cobra's newly redesigned adjustment provides 30 percent more gripping capacity than previous models.

A simple push of the patented push button adjustment maintains jaw size setting and gives you the correct size opening every time. Just position the upper jaw to the workpiece, push the button, adjust the opening, and close the lower jaw. And it's easily done with just one hand for trouble-free operation in confined spaces. 

Cobra water pump pliers are constructed from chrome vanadium electric steel, an innovative high alloy, oil tempered steel that ensures longevity. And their thin head design helps you get into spaces other pliers can't, so there's no need to change tools when working in tight confines. 

Patented push button system (view larger).QUALITY IN EVERY DETAIL
Sometimes we give our pliers a really hard time. We try to destroy them to find out what makes them good and long-lasting. Because we don't want to leave anything to chance, we take a long, careful look. 

The steel Knipex uses is precisely hardened with a maximum of 0.8 percent carbon and defined parts of chromium and vanadium, guaranteeing optimum cutting performance and service life — even though it requires special production and costs a bit more. But our high product demands require this.

The rivet of our high-leverage diagonal cutter also has to stand up to a lot of stress. That's why we literally give it backup: we forge it straight onto the pliers. This means extra effort as we have to precision mill the rivet to a few hundredth millimeters. But satisfied users are worth this effort.

Knipex also looks closely at the small details. The angles, the sharpness, the hardness, the toughness of the cutting edges. The precision and smooth movement of the joint. The handle design and the finish. We keep reviewing these subjects, we research, we test, and we improve our pliers.

ABOUT KNIPEX
Headquartered in Wuppertal, Germany, Knipex is an independently-owned family enterprise steeped in tradition and specializing in the manufacturing of high-quality pliers. It all started back in 1882 when C. Gustav Putsch set up his own forge shop in Cronenberg (now a suburb of Wuppertal), and the company is now run by a fourth generation of that family. The world's leading brand in pliers today, Knipex is focused on the performance, service life, and ergonomics of its tools in order to meet the high expectations of professional users.

00 20 06 US1 COBRA PLIERS, 3-PIECE SET
AT A GLANCE
 * Adjustment at the touch of a button directly on the workpiece
 * Fast, firm adjustment directly on the workpiece
 * Self-locking on pipes and nuts: no slipping on the workpiece and low hand force required
 * Gripping surfaces with special hardened teeth
 * Pinch guard prevents operators' fingers from being pinched
 * Chrome vanadium heavy-duty steel, forged and oil-hardened

WHAT'S IN THE BOX
7-1/4-inch pliers (87 01 180; view larger).
10-inch pliers (87 01 250; view larger).
12-inch pliers (87 01 300; view larger).


FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Fast adjustment directly on the work piece eliminates time-consuming test adjusting of the correct opening size. Just position the upper jaw to the work piece, push button on pliers and move close the lower jaw. Once adjusted the pliers self-lock on pipes and nuts with no slipping. Optimized shape jaw will grip round, square and hex shaped material. The box joint design provides high stability because of the double guide. The 3 piece set will handle pipe capacities from 1-1/4" to 2".

See more
